claim_text: The motivation is practical: Germany's \enquote{headline employment rate}—defined here as the share of persons aged 20--64 in employment—reached 81.3% in 2024, significantly outperforming the EU-27 average of 75.8% and the Union's 2030 target of 78% \parencite[p.~2]{eurostatEmployment2025}.
expected_snippet: To achieve this goal, the EU has set 3 targets for 2030, one of which is to attain a 78% employment rate for those aged 20-64 by 2030.

claim_text: National accounts data indicate that while dependent employment grew by approximately 10% between 2015 and the second quarter of 2024, the total volume of hours worked rose by only 7% \parencite[p.~3]{labourCompetitiveness2025}.
expected_snippet: From 2015 to the second quarter of 2024 * there has been strong growth in total dependent employment (+10%) and total hours worked (+7%)

claim_text: Under this ILO definition, Germany recorded 1.74 million unemployed persons (a rate of 3.9%) in August 2025 \parencite[p.~41]{monatsbericht-d-0-202508-pdf}.
expected_snippet: Die nach dem ILO-Erwerbskonzept vom Statistischen Bundesamt ermittelte Erwerbslosigkeit belief sich in Deutschland für den Juli auf 1,74 Mio und die Erwerbslosenquote auf 3,9 Prozent.

claim_text: This administrative lens reveals a higher stock of registered unemployment—3.03 million persons in August 2025—because it includes all individuals recorded under Germany's Social Code Books (\emph{Sozialgesetzbuch}, SGB) regardless of their immediate ILO status \parencite[p.~41]{monatsbericht-d-0-202508-pdf}.
expected_snippet: Von den 3.025.000 Arbeitslosen im August wurden 1.141.000 oder 38 Prozent im Rechtskreis SGB III von einer Agentur für Arbeit und 1.884.000 oder 62 Prozent im Rechtskreis SGB II von einem Jobcenter betreut.

claim_text: y ends in 2019; later sections therefore pair it with 2023--2025 establishment indicators—drawn from the annual IAB (Institut für Arbeitsmarkt- und Berufsforschung) Establishment Panel, a stratified survey of German workplaces whose indicators record whether establishments offer continuing training and whether skilled vacancies were filled at the survey date—and BA labour-market stocks (vacancies and short-time work) to update the transformation context \parencite[p.~6]{labourCompetitiveness2025}\parencite[p.~10]{monatsbericht-d-0-202508-pdf}.
context: 1. Reconceptualising Employability in Germany's Dual-Education Welfare State
expected_snippet: Assumptions: Interpretation of the curve segments linking peak annotated values (8.024, 5.995) to the end points (42, 211, 25) is based on visual geometry only, lacking defined arithmetic steps on the Y-axis.
